chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant John F Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full. Remaining bail refunded to poster.

No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 years of age.
No use of computers unless approved in advance by Agent.
Register as Sex Offender.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided.

Defendant John F Herrera in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 10 years (Initial Confinement: 5 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years) 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Court Costs of $268.00 - Apply Bail and refund balance
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - Apply Bail and refund balance    
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 years of age. No use of computer unless approved in advance by agent. Register as sex offender.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the sheriff.
From Atty Kees filed with treatment and character letters.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
